features: Light Wings 120mm PWM high-speed for vibrant unique look thanks to ARGB LEDs
Airflow-optimized fan blades for high pressure and low noise-generating turbulences
4 high-performance 6mm heat pipes with HDT technology
Asymmetrical construction avoids blocking memory slots
body.description: Pure Rock 2 FX Black combines vibrant ARGB illumination with high cooling efficiency and is excellent for quiet multimedia and gaming systems. With a Light Wings 120mm PWM high-speed fan, 150W TDP cooling efficiency and four 6mm high-performance heatpipes, Pure Rock 2 FX Black offers an excellent price-to-performance ratio. Fin material: Aluminum Base material: Copper CPU contact surface: heat pipe direct touch Heatpipe number / Diameter (mm): 4 / 6 Surface treatment: Electrophoresis Fan dimensions (mm): 120 x 120 x 25 Speed @ 100% PWM /12V (rpm): 2000 Bearing technology: Rifle Connector: 4-pin PWM Lifespan (h / 25°C): 60,000

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: An exceptional value offer Excellent Cooling Efficiency Pure Rock 2 FX Black is aimed at the essential but illuminated category of PC systems. With 150W TDP it offers an excellent cooling capacity for multimedia and gaming systems, as well as show cases. Impressive Lighting Light Wings 120mm PWM high-speed offers ARGB lighting with 18 LEDs. The ring at the front makes for a magnificent appearance from every angle. Quiet Operation A highly optimized impeller achieves the silent operation be quiet! is famous for. With a noise level of 24.4dB(A) at maximum fan speed, it proves that instead of being a replacement the lighting is an addon to silent and very powerful operation.

Ensuring perfect heat transfer High-Performance Heat Pipes Pure Rock 2 FX Black is equipped with four 6mm heat pipes that have aluminum caps. This is key to its great cooling performance, because they transport the heat to optimum locations on the cooling fins. Highly Compatible Compact Design The asymmetrical construction does not block memory slots, saves space and makes Pure Rock 2 FX Black compatible with a full set of RAM modules. It is also very convenient to install, thanks to the fact you can mount it from above the motherboard. Elegant Black Surface The combination of vibrant ARGB illumination, an elegant black surface and the aluminum caps take care for Pure Rock 2 FX Black to perfectly integrate into any case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits in most any case and is very quiet and super easy to install!
reviews.reviewText: The Be Quiet Pure Rock 2 Slim is an aesthetically good looking unit. It's quite affordable compared to other comparable products from other vendors. It cools up to 130 Watts TDP, so make sure you check your CPU's TDP Wattage to make sure this cooler can handle it. Thermal paste is pre-applied and the default brackets setup is for AM4 AMD CPU's. They do include brackets for Intel CPU's, but it's a less eloquent mounting system than the default AMD mounting system. It comes with a 92mm fan, which helps with its compact size but still affords great (and quiet) cooling, airflow and overall performance. This product would not be good for extreme overclockers as you could potentially exceed the maximum TDP Wattage this fan is rated for. However, if you either leave your rig stock or even do mild overclocking, this fan should be more than sufficient for your needs - and at a very affordable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super cooler for an Intel i5 9400!
reviews.reviewText: This cooler replaced a severely underperforming Intel heatsink that came with the 9400. It's for my "hackintosh" which sports said chip (i5 9400). Day to day tasks were fine with the included cooler but for rendering video or doing anything else that was CPU intensive, the stock cooler would spool up and sound like an electric leaf blower. This cooler took that problem and stomped it flat.The CPU and this cooler are on a Gigabyte Z390 Designaire motherboard (nice board and it has thunderbolt too!) along with 32 GB of RAM. It runs dead silent and is very responsive.For installation, it wasn't too bad, just a little tedious. But that's with most coolers, really. It does involve taking both panels off of your case (each side) to access the back of the motherboard in order to fit the cooler's back plate. The instructions provided are adequate enough.You can probably get more bang for your $ by going with Thermalright but I don't know how quiet their coolers are compared to Be Quiet's. But it's definitely that: QUIET!It's best to chunk those stock coolers to the side and spend a little extra dough to get a good cooler so that you won't think your computer is about to grow wings and take off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very quiet, works well and cost effective
reviews.reviewText: Bought to replace an aging AMD fan that was getting extremely noisy and inefficient.This BK030 fan fits very well, easy to install and has a high cooling capacity (for my application). Worked well for about a year on my old computer and was moved to a new build recently. Computer is practically silent and CPU temps remain in recommended range.Price for this cooler was very attractive at the time of purchase, compared to similarly spec'ed coolers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Install was "easy" in the sense that everything needed was in the package. The process was straight forward, but not nearly as simple as other coolers on the market. I do think that if you can install RAM or a gfx card, you can do this, too.It comes with thermal compound already applied. Some will be happy with that, and others will likely remove it and apply their own. To each there own, I suppose.This thing is super quiet and works very well. Obviously, I'll need to look at how things are going in a few months, but for right now, brand new, super clean, my CPU idles at around 25c and while gaming is around 50c. That is a big improvement over my old temps!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to follow instructions with very well labeled parts. The fan is SUPER quiet. I got this setup because my old CPU cooler fan was off balance and making a truck load of noise. Now I cant hear this fan at all.That was my goal and this product delivered. Now for the surprise this cooler keeps my CPU about 15 degrees cooler than my old one did and I don't think I could make my PC suffer from thermal throttling even if I tried.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bang for bucks
reviews.reviewText: Installation is fairly easy, even for newbie like me, design is pretty cool, and fan is pretty quiet that I can hear cricket chirping from miles away :P

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solved a difficult ITX-mini desktop heat problem.
reviews.reviewText: I have an ITX-Mini industrial type all-in one ultra-slim open air mesh frame chassis & motherboard with an i7-4790S cpu, that has been a beast to tame workload heat, in this smallest of form-factor chassis, in an open to the elements temperature environment, and much to much dismay, and satisfaction, the Be Quite! Pure Rock LP finally solved my CPU heat throttling problems.The original OEM installed CPU cooler was essentially the basic original Intel aluminum lug & fin, topped with a fan, reference CPU cooler, but cut down to very low 37+mm profile to fit in an ultra-slim desktop chassis.Searching for better replacements I found the Noctua NH-L9i cooler was a few mm's tool tall to fit in the chassis, and that it had height tolerances problems in the CPU clearance zone underneath the CPU cooler.An ARCTIC Alpine 12 LP did fit the clearance issues, and had lower noise, and power use; however still being based on an aluminum lug & fin design, (no heat pipes), still was not able to keep up with sustained temperatures, under even moderate loads.When Be Quite announced their new LP cooler and that it was a copper heat pipe design, fit into the most minimal/maximal dimensions limits allowed for CPU cooler tolerance zones, and could tame even newer generation CPU's, I was skeptical. But as a still last ditch resort to keep a workhorse computer thermally tamed, I decided to purchase one, give a try, with the clearance issues, see if I could even get it installed, and if it could improve on the Alpine LP.Mission successful !!!The install was razor shave close cut; not even micro-micrometers to spare in clearance tolerance all the way around, after mounting; from the top of the fan just barely touching the chassis cover, and with the CPU cold plate fit and around & underneath the cooler; including the cooler and mounting bracket just barely fit over a row of power capacitors sitting just below the bracket. The mounting certainly is "flexible" but this turned out to be a benefit, after getting the mounting brackets and screws tightened into place.The bracket installation wrench provided & needed to tighten the CPU mounting bolts, (not the mounting screws), had some difficulty getting around tight part clearances, that were right up and into the CPU cooler clearance zone, but I was able to work the wrench enough to secure the mounting bolts to the brackets; then tighten the mounting screws.After turning the system back on, immediately I noticed a 10-20 deg F. reduction, as compared to typical temps with the Alpine LP. And even with now spring summer temperatures coming on, and the ability to cool the cpu is being impacted by increase in ambient air temps, the Be Quit! LP has continued to maintain the heat dissipation, through all load testing; most notably that CPU is staying below throttle temperatures where; the OEM installed could never do, and Alpine LP could barely keep up with!Additionally noticed is that the noise level was way down, even at full RPM the Be Quit! Any fan noise had a slight low hum winy noise, but only noticeable at maximum RPM.Overall, this CPU cooler solved a long and ongoing cooling problem in a very minimalist chassis install, and it does it with no no high speed fans, or related added noise.

reviews.reviewerName: Eder Enrique Correa OchoaEder Enrique Correa Ochoa
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Lo tengo instalado sobre un Ryzen 7 3700X, con pruebas de Cinebench 2024 y con la pasta térmica pre aplicada de fabrica, me da una temperatura máxima de 85 grados, durante un uso normal y con videojuegos, no eh visto que pase de los 65 grados, así que siento que trabaja bastante bien este disipador, espero que con un cambio de pasta a una mejor, las temperaturas bajen sobre los límites actuales. Solo comentaría que si piensan usar algún procesador con un TDP mayor a 100W, mejor busquen otra opción de disipación, porque si siento que les quedará corto, al menos que piensen hacer undervolting o usar metal líquido o cubiertas de carbono para mejorar la disipación.

Lo usé en un ryzen primero con un Ryzen 5 5600g. Después con un Ryzen 9 5900x(Este con PBO a -30). Con los dos hizo un excelente trabajo tomando en cuenta que es de una sola torre, con el ryzen 9 lo máximo que consigo en temperatura con cinnebench r23 son 72c grados y consumiendo aprox 130w. Lo siguiente es raro pero el ryzen 5 5600g se calentaba hasta 69c grados con un consumo de aprox 66w. Tal vez es de esos disipadores que con alto consumo se comportan mejor.Es súper fácil de instalar y no hace ruído. Lo tengo con la pasta térmica de Artic MX-4 en el ryzen 9.El único problema que considero que tiene, es el precio. La verdad por ese precio podrías conseguir un disipador de doble torre que se comporte mejor, como el Peerless Assassin de Termalright. Aún así le doy las 5 estrellas porque es un buen producto y este tema de el precio, no es algo exclusivo de este disipador, si no de la mayoría.

Using this to cool my 5600X and it's a really good replacement for the Wraith Stealth cooler.It's both cheaper and smaller than the Hyper 212 with almost the same performance. I wouldn't want to use it on a 5950X or a highly overclocked system but my 65w 5600X is well within it's capabilities and it doesn't come close to throttling at full load. With the Wraith Stealth cooler the processor would throttle slightly.Runs very quietly even under load. MUCH quieter than the Wraith Stealth. Very easy to mount and it comes with the AM4 mounting hardware pre-installed. Highly recommended.

Ya tenia el pure rock slim 1, pero hice un upgrade de mi computadora y ahora compre un Ryzen 5 3600 asi que tuve que hacer upgrade a el Pure Rock Slim 2, aunque es un poquito mas grande que el 1, sigue siendo muy silencioso. Me gusto que el ventilador ya es mas facil de poner por la forma que le dieron a las laminitas de aluminio. En cuanto a rendimieno si bajo las temperaturas cerca de 10 grados a comparacion del disipador original del procesador, y en cuanto a ruido es muy silencioso, no se oye el ventilador, unicamente se oyen los ventiladores del gabinete que son de 12 cm.

Pros+ Quiet+ Good at cooling the CPU+ Good value for moneyCons- When installing, the detachable metal wires that are used to secure the fan to the heatsink is annoying because it's tricky to get it secured
